Description: Fragment of a large pottery vessel; coarse, grey clay, red towards the surface, with many white spots and mica. Exterior: two white and one broad purple band. Inside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 45, no. E 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.167)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2923 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
